snippet: Ronald Pofalla, who ran the German chancellery, was reported to be taking a specially created lobbying post at the national rail network said to carry compensation of more than a million euros a year.
abstract: Ronald Pofalla, who ran chancellery of German leader Angela Merkel, becomes second of her allies in two months to leave public service for a lucrative business post on the board of Deutsche Bahn; nongovernmental groups renew calls for laws imposing longer intervals between leaving government and entering business.
lead_paragraph: Ronald Pofalla, who ran the German chancellery, was reported to be taking a specially created lobbying post at the national rail network said to carry compensation of more than a million euros a year.

headline.main: German Politician’s Rush to Lobbying Brings Scorn
headline.print_headline: German Politician’s Rush To Lobbying Brings Scorn
